name: cli-simple-table
description: When you want to a quick and light way to display tabular data in a CLI

name: code-inject-loader
description: When you want to prepend, append, or transform source files at build-time in your Webpack-bundled app

name: deps
description: When you want to precisely identify which package dependencies are being executed

name: esbuild-loader
description: When you have a Webpack build and want to speed up JS/TS compilation or minification with [esbuild](https://github.com/evanw/esbuild)

name: github-cdn
description: When you want to host a CDN from your Github Enterprise

name: htmlvue-loader
description: When you have a Webpack build and want to import HTML or XML files (eg. SVGs) as a Vue component

name: i-peers
description: When you want to install your npm package's peerDependencies

name: markdown-it-add-attrs
description: When you're using [markdown-it](https://github.com/markdown-it/markdown-it) and want to add a class or attribute to every MD element (eg. to scope CSS just to MD)

name: md-vue-loader
description: When you want to import Markdown files, with inline Vue demos, as a Vue component in a Webpack-bundled app

name: mempack
description: When you want to run a completely in-memory Webpack build

name: minification-benchmarks
description: When you want to compare JS minifiers

name: motion-orientation-api
description: When you want to visualize and understand the data you get from the [Motion & Orientation API](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/native-hardware/device-orientation)

name: postcss-import-alias
description: When you're using PostCSS and want to use aliases in your `@import`s

name: postcss-preset-env-playground
description: When you want to play with the different configurations of [PostCSS preset-env](https://github.com/csstools/postcss-preset-env/) to understand how to use it

name: reactive-json-file
description: When you want to save JS data automatically as you change them

name: repkg
description: When you want to convert or package a npm package (or a specific file) to AMD/UMD on-demand

name: rollup-plugin-htmlvue
description: When you want to import HTML or XML (eg. SVGs) as a Vue component in your Rollup-bundled app

name: svg-trace-loader
description: When you have a Webpack build and want to flatten the SVGs you import into a single `<path>`

name: vue-demo-collapse
description: When you want to present your Vue demo nicely with a collapsible code section

name: vue-dom-hints
description: When you want a minimal alternative to [Vue.js devtools](https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/vuejs-devtools/nhdogjmejiglipccpnnnanhbledajbpd?hl=en)

name: vue-feather-icon-set
description: When you want to an optimized [Feather](https://feathericons.com/) icon set for Vue

name: vue-frag
description: When you want to return multiple root elements in a stateful Vue component

name: vue-import-loader
description: When you want to automatically import & register components used in your template (like [@nuxt/components](https://github.com/nuxt/components))

name: vue-proxi
description: When you want to proxy Vue component props and event-handlers to a child component

name: vue-pseudo-window
description: When you want to add event-handlers or classes to the document or window from the Vue component template

name: vue-split-view
description: When you want a vertically or horizontally re-sizeable split-view in your Vue app

name: vue-subslot
description: When you want to pick out specific elements from a Vue component slot

name: vue-svg-icon-set
description: When you want to create an icon-set in Vue using Webpack

name: vue-vnode-syringe
description: When you want to add classes, attributes, or event-handlers to the slot content in a Vue component

name: webpack-dependency-size
description: When you want to track or evaluate all the dependency files being bundled into your Webpack distribution

name: webpack-distsize
description: When you want to track Webpack distribution size in your version control
